name: sfchronicle
text:
JUST IN: The coronavirus infected more than 200 people who live or work at Golden Gate Fields despite a shutdown of all racing at the Bay Area’s only horse track.

https://t.co/4LmEqC5Iks

name: sfchronicle
text:
102 years ago, on Nov. 21, 1918, San Franciscans tired of the Spanish flu threw off their masks. 

The flu roared back in January, nearly doubling the death toll, and taking advantage of a city that had completely let down its guard.

https://t.co/TFJLbsSi7e

name: sfchronicle
text: Many people who test positive for the virus in San Francisco aren’t sure how they got it, and the city’s contact tracing team often can’t help them figure it out. https://t.co/AUKHGwzOTn

name: sfchronicle
text: “We’ve never had a light at the end of the tunnel before. It’ll be a good six months before everyone can get the vaccine, but the light is there.” https://t.co/XmQ6a7AFgA

name: sfchronicle
text:
JUST IN: Antibody treatment used by President Trump given emergency FDA authorization. Made by the pharmaceutical firm Regeneron, it can can now be offered to patients diagnosed with coronavirus and at significant risk of disease.

https://t.co/ViXymP5IRO

name: sfchronicle
text:
“Why don’t you act like a white person in a white neighborhood?” Dean asked Gerritt Jones, Jariell's brother, on Monday, according to videos posted on Twitter. The videos included security footage from the Jones’ home and cell phone footage.

https://t.co/qEZZ8e1jZL

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Warriors are signing guard Brad Wanamaker to a one-year, $2.25 million contract, a league source confirmed with The Chronicle.

Though not a splashy addition, his signing offers the Warriors much-needed backcourt depth.

https://t.co/FGknX5el7c
